moves.3. e5 Bf5 4. Bd3: A very playable line, but it plays right into the caro-kanns main idea, i.e., riding my light-square bishop for his active light square bishop.
moves.4... Bxd3 5. Qxd3 e6 6. Nf3 Qa5+ 7. Bd2: Isn't this the main line of the Caro-Kann advance? It's the way I like to play
moves.8. Qxa6 Nxa6 9. Nc3 Ne7 10. O-O-O Ng6 11: So I can keep the knight on g6.
moves.12. a3 f6: Attacking the Pawn chain head-on. I've read that you can do so in the Caro-Kann but shouldn't do in the French advance.
moves.13. exf6 gxf6 14. Rhe1 Nc7 15. g3 O-O-O: Kd7 would've have suffice as well :)
I should've just gone through my plan and take on f2
moves.43. Re7+ Kd6 44. Re8 Rf1xf2 45. Rxf2 Rxf: His Rook is out of play. Thus givin'  me an advantage over him.
